definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Each piece had a gold rim and a band of roses.
sentences.chinese: 每一件都繪有金邊和玫瑰花束。

sentences.english: The rose in the valley is blooming so sweet.
sentences.chinese: 山谷裏玫瑰花長得豐茂。

sentences.english: Xiao Wang gave his wife a bouquet of roses for their wedding anniversary.
sentences.chinese: 小王在結婚紀念日送給妻子一束玫瑰花。

sentences.english: And the roses and the hymn-book told the real truth.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花與聖歌都說出了真正的事實。

sentences.english: The little girl had learned a hymn, in which there was something about roses;
sentences.chinese: 小女孩念熟了一首聖詩，那裏就提到玫瑰花。

sentences.english: The roses are suffering from fungus .
Roses shave thorns, and silver fountains mud;
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花有刺，銀色的泉有爛泥。

sentences.english: Youth is a ring of rose, old is the crown of thorns.
sentences.chinese: 青春是玫瑰花環，老年如荊刺王冠。
科林斯便漸漸取代了玫瑰花盆。

sentences.english: Anna's boyfriend brought a bunch of roses to her.
sentences.chinese: 安娜的男友帶了一束玫瑰花給她。

sentences.english: She can differentiate this kind of rose from the others.
sentences.chinese: 她能把這種玫瑰花從其他品種中區分開來。

sentences.english: And I will make thee beds of roses, And then a thousand fragrant posies .
sentences.chinese: 我會用玫瑰花爲你鋪牀，有成千束花，散放出芬芳。

sentences.english: A vase of roses cheered up the room.
sentences.chinese: 一瓶玫瑰花使得房間生氣盎然。

sentences.english: After pruning, apply a rose fertiliser and mulch.
sentences.chinese: 修剪後施玫瑰花肥，培土。

sentences.english: The rose was chosen as the star flower because of its immense popularity.
sentences.chinese: 玫瑰花被選作明星花是因爲它極負盛名。

sentences.english: you remember the color of the rose?
sentences.chinese: 你還記得玫瑰花的顏色嗎？
